page.title: 02Lobley Hill
page.content: Until l972 lay on the old borough boundary and marked the extent of the town's western expansion. From l936 new housing was created on the hillside above the new Team Valley industrial estate. Council houses on the lower slopes were followed by private ones up the hill designed to provide economical housing for those attracted away from the town centre terraces. Shops are to be found in two centres either side of the A692 Lobley Hill Road. A primary school was built in l95O and two secondary schools in the l96O's. A library, community and health centre, a park and garden centre are the main local amenities. Recent years have seen a major growth in commuter traffic from the west.
